value.Subject: RE: Issue #82380: Inventory by Lot report (BioQ Pharma Incorporated)
value.BodyPreview:
Hi Chris,

The error you were getting is a result of a bug that Microsoft is working to resolve with the columns in the Edit in Excel function.  However, you can still get the data that’s needed.  For now, just ignore the error message.

As for the Ve

Body.Content:
Hi Chris,

 

The error you were getting is a result of a bug that Microsoft is working to resolve with the columns in the Edit in Excel function.  However, you can still get the data that’s needed.  For now, just ignore the error message.

 

As for the Vendor Lot No. field, using the out of the box fields available, you may use the “Description” field in the Lot No. Information Card.  Below are steps on how to populate the information.

 

  1. In an Item Journal go to Navigate > Line > Lot No. Information Card

 

 

  1. Populate the vendor lot number in the “Description” field.  The description field is a free text field that isn’t used now, so we can use it to capture the vendor lot number.

 

 

  1. If we the Description field, the report you can use to see the information is using a Config Package.  I created one called “LOTINFO” and it’s linked to the Lot No. Card Information table.  You can export the package to see the data.

 

 

The above is using the out of the box fields.  However, if it doesn’t work for you, we can do something a little more customized.  Just note that for this particular field, it won’t be just simple field to add as we’ll need to add it the item master window and all the transaction windows (i.e. Purchase Order, Purchase Invoice, Sales Order, Sales Invoice, and Production Orders); plus, we’ll need to add logic to carry the information from window to window and page to page.  Lastly, for any custom wok we will need to do it via a support plan.  If you do decide a custom field is needed, then we can scope out the exact requirements.

 

Thanks

Katrina 

 

From: Vasilas <vasilas@bioqpharma.com>
Sent: October 11, 2018 2:04 PM
To: Katrina She <Katrina.She@websan.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>; Abhi Patel <abhi.patel@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #82380: Inventory by Lot report (BioQ Pharma Incorporated)

 

Hi Katrina,

Thank you, I was able to follow the instructions below and it all seemed to work. I did receive an error (attached), but it didn’t seem to trip me up on anything else.

 

If there is no assigned “Vendor Lot No.” field, is there another field we could use for this info? Please let me know if you have an ideas about this.

 

Thanks

Chris

 

 

Chris Vasilas

Operations Director

BioQ Pharma Incorporated

Phone: (415) 889-7685

International: +1 415 889 7685

vasilas@bioqpharma.com

BioQuiddity Incorporated has changed its name to BioQ Pharma.

 

From: Katrina She <Katrina.She@websan.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 11, 2018 10:45 AM
To: Vasilas <vasilas@bioqpharma.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>; Abhi Patel <abhi.patel@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #82380: Inventory by Lot report (BioQ Pharma Incorporated)

 

Hi Chris,

 

Please see my notes below:

 

  1. Edit in Excel

When you open the Excel worksheet, click on “Enable Editing”.  This will ask you to populate your login information; it will be your O365 login.  Then the worksheet will populate the data. 

 

 

  1. Add Lot Number Column

To add the Lot Number column, go to the Gear icon and click on Personalize.  Then click on More and “+ Field”. 

This will open up the list of fields you can add to the page.  Find the field “Lot No.” and drag it onto the page.

 

 

 

  1. Filtering Report

Using the Edit in Excel report, filter on the “Remaining Quantity” column and then sort or filter on the Lot No. column.  This will then filter on only the remaining quantities with lots.

 

  1. Item Setup

In the TEST company, all the items that do not have a transaction attached have been updated to be Lot tracked.  All the items in the PROD company will be updated to be lot tracked. 

 

  1. Vendor Item Number

There isn’t a Vendor Lot Number field.

 

Thanks

Katrina

 

 

From: Vasilas <vasilas@bioqpharma.com>
Sent: October 11, 2018 1:25 PM
To: Katrina She <Katrina.She@websan.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>; Abhi Patel <abhi.patel@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #82380: Inventory by Lot report (BioQ Pharma Incorporated)

 

Hi Katrina,

Thanks for the info. A few questions/comments:

  • When I try to edit in Excel on Item Ledger Entries, the excel file is blank. Is there something else I need to select before clicking “Edit in Excel”?
  • How do I add lot number column?
  • This report shows all ledger entries, do I just look at lot numbers and remaining quantity or how to I filter out other entries so that I just see one line item per lot and location/quantity?

 

Are the items now set up to all be lot controlled? I just was thinking and some subcontractors assign their own lot number. Is there a field for “Vendor Lot No.” similar to a separate field for Vendor Item Number?

 

Thanks

Chris

 

 

Chris Vasilas

Operations Director

BioQ Pharma Incorporated

Phone: (415) 889-7685

International: +1 415 889 7685

vasilas@bioqpharma.com

 


This email and any attached file is intended only for the person(s) or the entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged, confidential or otherwise protected from disclosure. If you have received this email in error, please immediately notify sender by calling 415.889.7685 or email to vasilas@bioqpharma.com with a copy to admin@bioqpharma.com. BioQuiddity Incorporated has changed its name to BioQ Pharma.

 

From: Katrina She <Katrina.She@websan.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 11, 2018 7:53 AM
To: Vasilas <vasilas@bioqpharma.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>; Abhi Patel <abhi.patel@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #82380: Inventory by Lot report (BioQ Pharma Incorporated)

 

Hi Chris,

 

For the item lot tracking reports, below are the ones you can use:

 

  1. Item Tracing
  • Search for “Item Tracing”
  • Select the field filters
  • Go to Process > Trace
  • This view allows you to find certain lots and will show the quantities. 

 

 

  1. Item Ledger Entries
  • If you want a report that lists the lots, you may use the “Item Ledger Entries” view. 
  • Add in the column “Lot No.”
  • Or Click on “Edit in Excel” to export the data into Excel

 

 

Thanks,

 

 

______________________

Katrina She

  

Project Manager | WebSan Solutions Inc. | www.websan.com

Office (416) 499-1235 x 211 | DID: (647) 776-9961|Fax (416) 499-6889

katrina.she@websan.com

value.Subject: RE: Issue #81899: Recurring Malvern Issue (Stanley E. Smith)
value.BodyPreview:
Hi Derek,

Previously we were seeing an average of about 1 batch having errors every 2 hours or so.  Since the last update (mid-day yesterday) there have been 0 errors (for over 11,000 record inserts/updates synchronized in that time)

We will continu

Body.Content:
Hi Derek,

 

Previously we were seeing an average of about 1 batch having errors every 2 hours or so.  Since the last update (mid-day yesterday) there have been 0 errors (for over 11,000 record inserts/updates synchronized in that time)

 

We will continue to monitor for the near future, but everything is looking good right now.

 

______________________

Matt Locke

 

Lead Application Developer | WebSan Solutions Inc. | www.websan.com

Office (416) 499-1235 x 218 | DID: (647) 776-9968|Fax (416) 499-6889

value.Subject: RE: Issue #81863: Update Invoice (K and K Recycling)
value.BodyPreview:
Hi Divya,

From what I understand, the tax is auto generated once the sale is verified in the system based on the delivery address of the shipment. For every delivery address (destination location) in CRM, we link it to a province in CRM that must have

Body.Content:
Hi Divya,

 

From what I understand, the tax is auto generated once the sale is verified in the system based on the delivery address of the shipment. For every delivery address (destination location) in CRM, we link it to a province in CRM that must have a tax value associated with it. I hope this helps!

 

Danielle

 

From: Divya Pal [mailto:divya.pal@websan.com]
Sent: October-12-18 10:34 AM
To: Ken Sweeney <ksweeney@kkrecycling.ca>; Danielle Morgan <dmorgan@titantubeinc.com>; Wayne Wang <wwang@titantubeinc.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>; Renee Rouleau <rrouleau@titantubeinc.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #81863: Update Invoice (K and K Recycling)

 

Hi Ken,

 

I am waiting for further information on where tax is entered or where you would select a specific tax rate per invoice. A screenshot of the window and the path should be enough. Although, if you’re only looking for GST and QST tax amounts I can just add a custom calculation to the invoice instead. My only concern with that is if there were a sale using a different tax rate (that is not GST or QST) it wouldn’t be captured on the invoice with a custom calculation.

 

Just need confirmation on either going the custom calculation route or pulling values from CRM itself.

 

Thanks,

______________________

Divya Pal  

BI Specialist | WebSan Solutions Inc. | www.websan.com

Office (416) 499-1235 x 237 | DID: (647) 776-0611 |Fax (416) 499-6889

divya.pal@websan.com

 

From: Ken Sweeney <ksweeney@kkrecycling.ca>
Sent: Thursday, October 11, 2018 3:30 PM
To: Divya Pal <divya.pal@websan.com>; Danielle Morgan <dmorgan@titantubeinc.com>; Wayne Wang <wwang@titantubeinc.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>; Renee Rouleau <rrouleau@titantubeinc.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #81863: Update Invoice (K and K Recycling)

 

Divya

 

Just following up to see if you have been able to resolve this.

 

Thanks

 

 

Ken Sweeney

CFO

 

870 McKay Road

Pickering, ON L1W 2Y4

T: 905 426-8989 ext. 24

C: 905 466-8541

F: 905 426-4927

ksweeney@kkscrapmetal.com

www.kkscrapmetal.com

 

From: Divya Pal <divya.pal@websan.com>
Sent: October 10, 2018 4:12 PM
To: Danielle Morgan <dmorgan@titantubeinc.com>; Wayne Wang <wwang@titantubeinc.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>; Renee Rouleau <rrouleau@titantubeinc.com>; Ken Sweeney <ksweeney@kkrecycling.ca>
Subject: RE: Issue #81863: Update Invoice (K and K Recycling)

 

Hello,

 

I am currently in the process of figuring out how to breakdown the taxes portion of the invoice. Is there somewhere in CRM where this tax information is entered? Or a window where you select the specific rate that needs to be chosen? I am having difficulty finding this field in the backend and it would be easier to see which window/field you would enter that information in CRM.

 

Alternatively, I can add a custom calculation to the invoice to see the GST dollar amount and QST dollar amount based on the current tax rates however, if invoices are sent to other provinces with different rates it wouldn’t be accounted for with a custom calculation. If these tax rates are the only ones you are interested in seeing then a custom calculation should suffice.

 

 

Let me know what works.

 

Thank you,

______________________

Divya Pal  

BI Specialist | WebSan Solutions Inc. | www.websan.com

Office (416) 499-1235 x 237 | DID: (647) 776-0611 |Fax (416) 499-6889

divya.pal@websan.com

Thank you for choosing WebSan! Please take a moment to complete our survey by following the link below as we continue to improve to serve you better.

Body.Content:
*===* Email copy generated by issue Email Distribution List.

Thank you for choosing WebSan! Please take a moment to complete our survey by following the link below as we continue to improve to serve you better.

https://form.jotformpro.com/72325958271967??ticketNumber=82377

The following Issue was closed in WebSan Support:
Issue #: 82377
Subject: Integration issue
Status: Closed Under Review
Issue Type: GP
Priority: Critical
Severity:
Project:
Organization: Distincttech
Submitted By: Soheil Mosavi on 10-Oct-2018
Assigned To: Enterprise Team Queue on 10-Oct-2018
Next Action: Thomas Jackson on 11-Oct-2018
Closed By: Enterprise Team Queue on 12-Oct-2018

Solution:
The blockage/stoppage was caused by a single record in CRM that was not entered correctly. The account is the first integration to go and because the account number is not set (assuming because its locked down as it likely gets generated
from some process or comes from GP) it generated a record that did not have the keys set. This caused the CRM Sync tool to break and all subsequent integrations to fail.
